sen.j: 東山駅（ひがしやまえき）は、京都市東山区にある、京都市営地下鉄京都市営地下鉄東西線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Higashiyama Station is a Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line station located in the Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City,
Higashiyama Station is a Kyoto City Subway Tozai Line station located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City,
Higashiyama Station, located in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, is a stop on the Kyoto Municipal Subway Tozai Line.
sen.cmt: 表現を他ファイルと統一しました。

sen.j: 駅番号はT10。
sen.e: Its station number is T10.
Its station number is T10.
Its station number is T10.

sen.j: ホームは地下3層にあり、他の東西線の駅と同様、複線島式ホームで、プラットホーム安全対策が設置されている。
sen.e: The platform is on the third basement level, and just like platforms of other Tozai Line stations, it is a double-track, island platform with safety barriers.
The platform is on the third basement level, and like platforms of other Tozai Line stations it's a double-track, island platform with safety barriers.
The platform is on the third basement level, and like platforms of other Tozai Line stations it's a double-track, island platform with safety barriers.

sen.j: 2007年4月より、改札口券売機前に、京都市営バスの接近表示が設置された。
sen.e: In April 2007, a warning display board showing the approach of a Kyoto City bus was installed in front of the ticket vending machine at the ticket gates.
In April 2007, a warning display board showing the approach of a Kyoto City bus was installed in front of the ticket vending machine at the ticket gates.
In April 2007, a warning display board showing the approach of a Kyoto City bus was installed in front of the ticket vending machine at the ticket gates.

sen.j: 東西線の駅は駅ごとにステーションカラーが制定されているが、東山駅のステーションカラーは菖蒲色。
sen.e: Each station on the Tozai Line is assigned a unique station color; the station color of Higashiyama Station is pale blue.
Each station on the Tozai Line is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Higashiyama Station is pale blue.
Each station on the Tozai Line is assigned a unique station color, and the color for Higashiyama Station is pale blue.

sen.j: 京都・東山花灯路‎の時期には、コンコース階改札外に床置きの行灯が置かれる。
sen.e: During the Kyoto Higashiyama Lantern Festival, lanterns are placed on the concourse floor near the ticket gates.
During the Kyoto Higashiyama Lantern Festival, lanterns are placed on the concourse floor near the ticket gates.
During the Kyoto Higashiyama Lantern Festival, lanterns are placed outside the ticket gate on the concourse floor.
sen.cmt: コンコース階改札外の表現を修正しました。

sen.j: 地上へあがると東山三条（三条通と東大路通の交差点）で、平安神宮など岡崎公園 (京都市)一帯の観光拠点として利用されている。
sen.e: Coming up from the underground station, we find ourselves at Higashiyama Sanjo (intersection of Sanjo-dori Street and Higashioji-dori Street), which is why this station is often used as a base for tours of the surrounding areas, including Heian-jingu Shrine and Okazaki Park (Kyoto City).

Coming up from the underground station, we find ourselves at Higashiyama Sanjo (the intersection of Sanjo-dori Street and Higashioji-dori Street), which is why this station is often used as a base for tours of the surrounding area, including Heian-jingu Shrine and Okazaki Park (Kyoto City).

Coming up from the underground station, we find ourselves at Higashiyama Sanjo (the intersection of Sanjo-dori Street and Higashioji-dori Street), which is why this station is often used as a base for tours of the surrounding area, including Heian-jingu Shrine and Okazaki Park (Kyoto City).

sen.j: 観光客は、京都駅から下記のような観光地に向かうのにバスを利用しがちであるが、この駅を利用して平安神宮等に向かうと渋滞を避けることが出来て便利である。
sen.e: While most tourists use bus service from Kyoto Station to visit tourist spots mentioned below, using this station to make a tour of Heian-jingu Shrine and other places provides a convenient way of avoiding traffic congestion.

While most tourists use bus service from Kyoto Station to visit the tourist spots mentioned below, by using this station to make tours of Heian-jingu Shrine and other places one can conveniently avoid traffic congestion.

While most tourists use bus service from Kyoto Station to visit the tourist spots mentioned below, by using this station to make tours of Heian-jingu Shrine and other places one can conveniently avoid traffic congestion.

sen.j: なお、11月などの紅葉観光の最混雑期には、銀閣寺平安神宮から東山三条を経由して京都駅に向かう市バス（5,57,100系統など）の乗客が、振り替え票を得て、この駅から京都駅まで地下鉄に乗り換えることのできる臨時的な措置が採られる。
sen.e: During peak congestion periods, such as the autumn leaf season in November, special transfer tickets are issued to passengers of Kyoto City buses that go to Kyoto Station via Ginkaku-ji Temple, Heian-jingu Shrine and Higashiyama Sanjo (routes 5, 57, 100, etc.) so that they can transfer from bus to subway at this station to go to Kyoto Station.

During peak congestion periods, such as the autumn leaf season in November, special transfer tickets are issued to passengers of the Kyoto City buses that go to Kyoto Station via Ginkaku-ji Temple, Heian-jingu Shrine and Higashiyama Sanjo (routes 5, 57, 100, etc.) so that they can transfer from bus to subway at this station in order to reach Kyoto Station.

During peak congestion periods, such as the autumn leaf season in November, special transfer tickets are issued to passengers of the Kyoto City buses that go to Kyoto Station via Ginkaku-ji Temple, Heian-jingu Shrine and Higashiyama Sanjo (routes 5, 57, 100, etc.) so that they can transfer from bus to subway at this station in order to reach Kyoto Station.

sen.j: このサービスは、東山三条以南の京都市内の道路が激しく渋滞している時に、京都駅に向かう観光利用者の利便を考えて特別に行われるものであり、日時も事前に明示されずに実施されるようである。
sen.e: This special service is given for the convenience of tourists going to Kyoto Station when Kyoto City roads south to Higashiyama Sanjo are heavily congested, apparently without announcing the schedule in advance.

This special service is given for the convenience of tourists going to Kyoto Station when the Kyoto City roads south to Higashiyama Sanjo are heavily congested, apparently without announcing the schedule in advance.

This special service is given for the convenience of tourists going to Kyoto Station when the Kyoto City roads south to Higashiyama Sanjo are heavily congested, apparently without announcing the schedule in advance.

sen.j: 駅施設は第三セクターである京都高速鉄道株式会社が建設。
sen.e: Higashiyama Station was built by a third-sector company named Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd.
Higashiyama Station was built by a third-sector company called Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd.
Higashiyama Station was built by a third-sector company called Kyoto Kosoku Railway Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards started to be used.
On April 1, 2007, PiTaPa cards came into use.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa cards came into use.

sen.j: 旧京阪京津線がここの地上を走っていた時の駅名は「東山三条駅」だった。
sen.e: The ground station that existed when trains were running on the ground on the former Keihan Keishin Line was known as Higashiyama Sanjo Station.
The ground station that existed when trains ran at ground level on the former Keihan Keishin Line was known as Higashiyama Sanjo Station.
The ground station that existed when trains ran at ground level on the former Keihan Keishin Line was known as Higashiyama Sanjo Station.

sen.j: つまり地下化に伴って「東山」に改称されたのである。
sen.e: In other words, the station was renamed Higashiyama Station when it was rebuilt as an underground station.
In other words, the station was renamed Higashiyama Station when it was rebuilt as an underground station.
In other words, the station was renamed Higashiyama Station when it was rebuilt as an underground station.

sen.j: この駅上を南北に走る通り名が東山通（東大路通）であることに由来すると思われる。
sen.e: The station's name comes from the name of Higashiyama-dori Street (or Higashioji Street), which runs from north to south above the station.
The station's is named after Higashiyama-dori Street (or Higashioji Street), which runs from north to south above the station.
The station is named after Higashiyama-dori Street (or Higashioji Street), which runs from north to south above the station.
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーsを削除しました。

sen.j: 「東山」はこの附近一帯の広域的な地名でもある。
sen.e: Higashiyama is also the name of the entire surrounding area.
The surrounding area is also called Higashiyama.
The surrounding area is also called Higashiyama.
